title: The Man Behind the Microchip: Robert Noyce and the Invention of Silicon Valley

The fascinating biography of Robert Noyce, an inventor of the microchip and founder of Fairchild and Intel. For anyone thinking of working in Silicon Valley, this book gives insights into the culture of the region, a culture influenced more heavily by Noyce than any other individual
The Pentium Chronicles: The People, Passion, and Politics Behind Intel’s Landmark Chips

An insider’s tale of the development of several generations of Intel’s Pentium chips, told by one of the leaders of the project. For those considering a career in the field, this book offers views into the managment of huge design projects and a behind-the-scenes look at one of the most significant commercial microprocessor lines
Digital Arithmetic
The most complete text on computer arithmetic systems. An excellent resource for building high-quality arithmetic units for computers
Computer Architecture: A Quantitative Approach
The authoritative text on advanced computer architecture. If you are intrigued about the inner workings of cutting-edge microprocessors, this is the book for you
The Soul of a New Machine
A classic story of the design of a computer system. Three decades later, the story is still a page-turner and the insights on project managment and technology still ring true
Circuit Design and Simulation with VHDL
A reference showing how to design circuits with VHDL
Advanced Digital Design with the Verilog HDL
A good reference for Verilog 2005

note: Available at ieeexplore.ieee.org. VHDL IEEE Standard (IEEE STD 1076).
title: The IEEE standard for the SystemVerilog Hardware Description Language; last updated in 2009

note: Available from IEEE. Available at ieeexplore.ieee.org.
title: The IEEE standard for VHDL; last updated in 2008
Digital Design: Principles and Practices
A comprehensive and readable text on digital design, and an excellent reference book
CMOS VLSI Design

Very Large Scale Integration (VLSI) Design is the art and science of building chips containing oodles of transistors. This book, coauthored by one of our favorite writers, spans the field from the beginning through the most advanced techniques used in commercial products
